intro: Synzyganthera purpurea, commonly known as the purple spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are surrounded by brightly colored bracts. Its foliage is typically lance-shaped with a waxy texture and a bluish-green hue. Synzyganthera purpurea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking purple bracts and adaptability to various growing conditions.
